ISSUE.TITLE: Numeric conversion utility functions do not account for floating point errors
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Deployment Type NetBox Cloud ### NetBox Version v4.2.5 ### Python Version 3.10 ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Attempt to convert feet to meters using the `to_meters()` utility function: ```python >>> from utilities.conversion import to_meters >>> to_meters(30, 'ft') Decimal('9.144000000000000460964599824') ``` ### Expected Behavior The function should return the clean decimal value 9.144. ### Observed Behavior The returned value includes a [floating point error](https://docs.python.org/3/tutorial/floatingpoint.html). The `to_grams()` utility function is affected as well.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixes #18869: Ensure to_meters() always returns a clean decimal value
